trans-unit.source: Querying Tables and Entities
trans-unit.target: Querying Tables and Entities

trans-unit.source: Querying tables and entities in the Table service requires careful construction of the request URI.
trans-unit.target: Querying tables and entities in the Table service requires careful construction of the request URI.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe query options and demonstrate some common scenarios.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe query options and demonstrate some common scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Basic Query Syntax
trans-unit.target: Basic Query Syntax

trans-unit.source: To return all of the tables in a given storage account, perform a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GET</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation on the Tables resource, as described in the <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: To return all of the tables in a given storage account, perform a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GET</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation on the Tables resource, as described in the <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: The basic URI for addressing the Tables resource is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The basic URI for addressing the Tables resource is as follows:

trans-unit.source: To return a single named table, specify that table as follows:
trans-unit.target: To return a single named table, specify that table as follows:

trans-unit.source: To return all entities in a table, specify the table name on the URI, without the Tables resource:
trans-unit.target: To return all entities in a table, specify the table name on the URI, without the Tables resource:

trans-unit.source: Query results are sorted by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, then by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Query results are sorted by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, then by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Ordering results in any other way is not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Ordering results in any other way is not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: You can specify additional options to limit the set of tables or entities returned, as described in the following <ui>Supported Query Options</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: You can specify additional options to limit the set of tables or entities returned, as described in the following <ui>Supported Query Options</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: The number of entities returned for a single request may be limited, if the query exceeds the maximum number of entities, exceeds the timeout interval, or crosses a partition boundary.
trans-unit.target: The number of entities returned for a single request may be limited, if the query exceeds the maximum number of entities, exceeds the timeout interval, or crosses a partition boundary.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported Query Options
trans-unit.target: Supported Query Options

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports the following query options, which conform to the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports the following query options, which conform to the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can use these options to limit the set of tables, entities, or entity properties returned by a query.
trans-unit.target: You can use these options to limit the set of tables, entities, or entity properties returned by a query.

trans-unit.source: System query option
trans-unit.target: System query option

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Returns only tables or entities that satisfy the specified filter.
trans-unit.target: Returns only tables or entities that satisfy the specified filter.

trans-unit.source: Note that no more than 15 discrete comparisons are permitted within a <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> string.
trans-unit.target: Note that no more than 15 discrete comparisons are permitted within a <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> string.

trans-unit.source: Returns only the top <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> tables or entities from the set.
trans-unit.target: Returns only the top <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> tables or entities from the set.

trans-unit.source: Returns the desired properties of an entity from the set.
trans-unit.target: Returns the desired properties of an entity from the set.

trans-unit.source: This query option is only supported for requests using version 2011-08-18 or newer.
trans-unit.target: This query option is only supported for requests using version 2011-08-18 or newer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.

trans-unit.source: Additional query options defined by OData are not supported by the Table service.
trans-unit.target: Additional query options defined by OData are not supported by the Table service.

trans-unit.source: Supported Comparison Operators
trans-unit.target: Supported Comparison Operators

trans-unit.source: Within a <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> clause, you can use comparison operators to specify the criteria against which to filter the query results.
trans-unit.target: Within a <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> clause, you can use comparison operators to specify the criteria against which to filter the query results.

trans-unit.source: For all property types, the following comparison operators are supported:
trans-unit.target: For all property types, the following comparison operators are supported:

trans-unit.source: Operator
trans-unit.target: Operator

trans-unit.source: URI expression
trans-unit.target: URI expression

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the following operators are supported for Boolean properties:
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the following operators are supported for Boolean properties:

trans-unit.source: Operator
trans-unit.target: Operator

trans-unit.source: URI expression
trans-unit.target: URI expression

trans-unit.source: For more information about filter syntax, see the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about filter syntax, see the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Query String Encoding
trans-unit.target: Query String Encoding

trans-unit.source: The following characters must be encoded if they are to be used in a query string:
trans-unit.target: The following characters must be encoded if they are to be used in a query string:

trans-unit.source: Forward slash (/)
trans-unit.target: Forward slash (/)

trans-unit.source: Question mark (?)
trans-unit.target: Question mark (?)

trans-unit.source: Colon (:)
trans-unit.target: Colon (:)

trans-unit.source: 'At' symbol (@)
trans-unit.target: 'At' symbol (@)

trans-unit.source: Ampersand (&)
trans-unit.target: Ampersand (&)

trans-unit.source: Equals sign (=)
trans-unit.target: Equals sign (=)

trans-unit.source: Plus sign (+)
trans-unit.target: Plus sign (+)

trans-unit.source: Comma (,)
trans-unit.target: Comma (,)

trans-unit.source: Dollar sign ($)
trans-unit.target: Dollar sign ($)

trans-unit.source: Sample Query Expressions
trans-unit.target: Sample Query Expressions

trans-unit.source: The following samples show how to construct the request URI for some typical entity queries using REST syntax.
trans-unit.target: The following samples show how to construct the request URI for some typical entity queries using REST syntax.

trans-unit.source: The same queries could be written using LINQ syntax.
trans-unit.target: The same queries could be written using LINQ syntax.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that both the <languageKeyword>$top</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> options can be used to filter on table names as well, using the syntax demonstrated for filtering on properties of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Note that both the <languageKeyword>$top</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> options can be used to filter on table names as well, using the syntax demonstrated for filtering on properties of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Returning the Top n Entities
trans-unit.target: Returning the Top n Entities

trans-unit.source: To return the top <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> entities for any query, specify the <languageKeyword>$top</languageKeyword> query option.
trans-unit.target: To return the top <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> entities for any query, specify the <languageKeyword>$top</languageKeyword> query option.

trans-unit.source: The following example returns the top 10 entities from a table named Customers:
trans-unit.target: The following example returns the top 10 entities from a table named Customers:

trans-unit.source: Filtering on the PartitionKey and RowKey Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on the PartitionKey and RowKey Properties

trans-unit.source: Because the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties form an entity's primary key, you can use a special syntax to identify the entity, as follows:
trans-unit.target: Because the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties form an entity's primary key, you can use a special syntax to identify the entity, as follows:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can specify these properties as part of the <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> option, as shown in the following section.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can specify these properties as part of the <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> option, as shown in the following section.

trans-unit.source: Note that the key property names and constant values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Note that the key property names and constant values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Both the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties are of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Both the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties are of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Constructing Filter Strings
trans-unit.target: Constructing Filter Strings

trans-unit.source: When constructing a filter string, keep these rules in mind:
trans-unit.target: When constructing a filter string, keep these rules in mind:

trans-unit.source: Use the logical operators defined by the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> to compare a property to a value.
trans-unit.target: Use the logical operators defined by the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> to compare a property to a value.

trans-unit.source: Note that it is not possible to compare a property to a dynamic value; one side of the expression must be a constant.
trans-unit.target: Note that it is not possible to compare a property to a dynamic value; one side of the expression must be a constant.

trans-unit.source: The property name, operator, and constant value must be separated by URL-encoded spaces.
trans-unit.target: The property name, operator, and constant value must be separated by URL-encoded spaces.

trans-unit.source: A space is URL-encoded as <codeInline>%20</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: A space is URL-encoded as <codeInline>%20</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: All parts of the filter string are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: All parts of the filter string are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: The constant value must be of the same data type as the property in order for the filter to return valid results.
trans-unit.target: The constant value must be of the same data type as the property in order for the filter to return valid results.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supported property types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Storage Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supported property types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Storage Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to check whether a property has been explicitly typed before assuming it is of a type other than string.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to check whether a property has been explicitly typed before assuming it is of a type other than string.

trans-unit.source: If a property has been explicitly typed, the type is indicated within the response when the entity is returned.
trans-unit.target: If a property has been explicitly typed, the type is indicated within the response when the entity is returned.

trans-unit.source: If the property has not been explicitly typed, it will be of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and the type will not be indicated within the response when the entity is returned.
trans-unit.target: If the property has not been explicitly typed, it will be of type <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>String</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and the type will not be indicated within the response when the entity is returned.

trans-unit.source: Filtering on String Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on String Properties

trans-unit.source: When filtering on string properties, enclose the string constant in single quotes.
trans-unit.target: When filtering on string properties, enclose the string constant in single quotes.

trans-unit.source: The following example filters on the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties; additional non-key properties could also be added to the query string.
trans-unit.target: The following example filters on the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> properties; additional non-key properties could also be added to the query string.

trans-unit.source: The following example filters on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FirstName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LastName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property:
trans-unit.target: The following example filters on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FirstName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LastName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property:

trans-unit.source: Note that the Table service does not support wildcard queries.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Table service does not support wildcard queries.

trans-unit.source: However, you can perform prefix matching by using comparison operators on the desired prefix.
trans-unit.target: However, you can perform prefix matching by using comparison operators on the desired prefix.

trans-unit.source: The following example returns entities with a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LastName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property beginning with the letter 'A':
trans-unit.target: The following example returns entities with a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>LastName</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property beginning with the letter 'A':

trans-unit.source: Filtering on Numeric Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on Numeric Properties

trans-unit.source: To filter on an integer or floating-point number, specify the constant value on the URI without quotes.
trans-unit.target: To filter on an integer or floating-point number, specify the constant value on the URI without quotes.

trans-unit.source: This example returns all entities with an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Age</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property whose value is greater than 30:
trans-unit.target: This example returns all entities with an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Age</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property whose value is greater than 30:

trans-unit.source: This example returns all entities with an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AmountDue</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property whose value is less than or equal to 100.25:
trans-unit.target: This example returns all entities with an <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AmountDue</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property whose value is less than or equal to 100.25:

trans-unit.source: Filtering on Boolean Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on Boolean Properties

trans-unit.source: To filter on a Boolean value, specify <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> without quotes.
trans-unit.target: To filter on a Boolean value, specify <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> without quotes.

trans-unit.source: The following example returns all entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>IsActive</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>:
trans-unit.target: The following example returns all entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>IsActive</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>:

trans-unit.source: Filtering on DateTime Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on DateTime Properties

trans-unit.source: To filter on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value, specify the <languageKeyword>datetime</languageKeyword> keyword on the URI, followed by the date/time constant in single quotes.
trans-unit.target: To filter on a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value, specify the <languageKeyword>datetime</languageKeyword> keyword on the URI, followed by the date/time constant in single quotes.

trans-unit.source: The date/time constant must be in combined UTC format, as described in <link xlink:href="0ff7afef-5b85-44ee-a6eb-17d4dd071f5a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Formatting DateTime Property Values</link>.
trans-unit.target: The date/time constant must be in combined UTC format, as described in <link xlink:href="0ff7afef-5b85-44ee-a6eb-17d4dd071f5a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Formatting DateTime Property Values</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following example returns entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CustomerSince</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is equal to July 10, 2008:
trans-unit.target: The following example returns entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>CustomerSince</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is equal to July 10, 2008:

trans-unit.source: Filtering on GUID Properties
trans-unit.target: Filtering on GUID Properties

trans-unit.source: To filter on a GUID value, specify the <languageKeyword>guid</languageKeyword> keyword on the URI, followed by the guid constant in single quotes.
trans-unit.target: To filter on a GUID value, specify the <languageKeyword>guid</languageKeyword> keyword on the URI, followed by the guid constant in single quotes.

trans-unit.source: The following example returns entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GuidValue</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is equal to :
trans-unit.target: The following example returns entities where the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GuidValue</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is equal to :
